results.title: True lies
results.creator_credit: Lightstorm Entertainment, James Cameron and Stephanie Austin
results.brief_description: Harry Tasker is an undercover spy who masquerades to his family as a dull computer salesman. Compounded by Henry’s many inexplicable absences, his wife Helen, feeling neglected and bored with their marriage, turns to sleazy car salesman Simon for excitement. Harry’s latest assignment is on the trail of several missing nuclear warheads that have been stolen by some maniacal Arab terrorists. James Cameron directs here with typical flair for exciting set pieces and a predilection for crude villain/hero and gender stereotypes. Arnold Schwarzenegger embraces the role as the omnipotent and duplicitous Harry who can tackle any form of violence and danger but whose response to a marriage crisis is to kidnap his wife, subject her to a terrifying interrogation, then send her on a bogus assignment as a prostitute. At the time of release the film was read as a cheeky update of the genre, but it offers quite a limited re-imaging of a James Bond type of hero. The best features are the film’s pace and some exciting chase sequences across rooftops and amidst exploding bridges et al. Imbued with generic trademark humour, “True lies” garnered criticism for its cliched representation of Arabic people and an excruciating scene where Helen strips for, (unknowingly), her husband.

results.title: True justice?
results.brief_description: Documentary containing sensitive material about the death, in 2004, of a young 17 year-old Aboriginal boy from Gamilaroi country (Walgett) known as TJ Hickey. Through interviews and news footage, the film attempts to establish the truth of what really happened to TJ whose “acccidental” death not only triggered a riot between the Redfern community and the police, but also conspiracy theories, rumours and media misinformation.

results.title: True homance
results.brief_description: As a memorial to love, the filmmaker turns to the camera in an attempt to document the experiences he shared with his first boyfriend, only to find the filmmaking process as illusive as memory.

results.title: True faith
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Lawrence Johnston
results.brief_description: True Faith is a dramatic examination of fidelity and relationships in the era of AIDS. At a nightclub, Alan bumps into Stewart, a past lover who has just recently returned to Melbourne. Stewart has been tested as HIV-Positive and his lover has recently died as a result of AIDS. Allan decides to get tested for AIDS. This is a delicately handled drama about a young man coming to terms with an HIV-Positive result, and how to break the news to his partner. Cast includes Dale Knight, Eric Scherer, Colin Batrouney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Lawrence Johnston

results.title: True Confessions of an Albino Terrorist
results.brief_description: A fascinating documentary that looks at the white South African writer/painter, Breyten Breytenbach, who is now living in Paris. Breytenbach, who revolted against the South African conditions of apartheid, discusses his experiences in South African prisons and also talks about his poetry and paintings.
results.description: A fascinating documentary that looks at the white South African writer/painter, Breyten Breytenbach, who is now living in Paris. results.title: True Australians
results.creator_credit: R.H. Miller and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Golden West Series”.
Filmed in the Jarrah and Karri forests of Western Australia, shows the felling of trees and transport by whim and rail to the mill. Aspects of reafforestation and fire control are also shown. Historically interesting film in light of when it was produced (1948) and the current debate in the year 2000 surrounding the logging of these forests in Western Australia.

results.title: Trucks in our neighbourhood: a first film
results.creator_credit: Frank Stokes, Dan McCarroll, BFA Educational Media and Film Associates
results.brief_description:
Shows the various trucks that might come to the neighbourhood. Also shows the workers who drive them as they provide services, make deliveries and repairs and do the general work needed to keep a neighbourhood running smoothly.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
